info.title: Stock Management
info.description:
**TMF API Reference : TMF 687 - Stock Management**

Release : 20.0 - January 2020

The Stock Management API provides standardized mechanism for product stock management such as creation, update and retrieval of the representation of a product stock, reserve product stock, check or query product stock or Adjust product Stock. It also allows the notification of events related to them

Copyright © TM Forum 2020. All Rights Reserved

AdjustProductStock.description: AdjustProductStock is used to log and execute on or several Product Stock level change

adjustReason.description: A reason for this product stock adjustment like theft or wastage.

completedAdjustProductStockDate.description: Date when the AdjustProductStock was created (whatever its status).

creationDate.description: Date when the AdjustProductStock was created (whatever its status).

instantSyncAdjust.description: An indicator which when the value is "true" means that requester expects the adjustment immediately. If the indicator is true then the response code of 200 indicates the operation is successful otherwise a task is created with a response 201.

requestedAdjustProductStockDate.description: Date when the AdjustProductStock was created (whatever its status).

state.description: State of the AdjustProductStock (acknowledged, inProgress, terminatedWithError, done)

AgreementItemRef.description: Agreement reference. An agreement represents a contract or arrangement, either written or verbal and sometimes enforceable by law, such as a service level agreement or a customer price agreement. An agreement involves a number of other business entities, such as products, services, and resources and/or their specifications.

CheckProductStock.description: CheckProductStock is used to log and execute check about product stock availability

completedCheckProductStockDate.description: Date when the CheckProductStock was completed.

creationDate.description: Date when the CheckProductStock was created (whatever its status).

instantSyncCheck.description: An indicator which when the value is "true" means that requester expects to get result immediately in the response. If the indicator is true then the response code of 200 indicates the operation is successful otherwise a task is created with a response 201.

provideAlternative.description: When the value is TRUE means that alternative proposal should be provided (from other product stock, different date or quantity)

requestedAvailabilityDate.description: Date when the stock availability should be check.

requestedCheckProductStockDate.description: Date when the requester wished to have a response for this product stock check query.

checkProductStockItem.description: A list of check product stock  item

place.description: Used to define a geographical place where requester wants to check stock availability

relatedParty.description: A list of related party references (RelatedParty [*]). A related party defines party or party role linked to this CheckProductStock

state.description: State of the CheckProductStock (acknowledged, inProgress, terminatedWithError, done)

availabilityResult.description: Result of the availability like available, notAvailable, alternate

provideAlternative.description: When the value is TRUE means that alternative proposal should be provided (from other product stock, different date or quantity)

alternate.description: A list of alternate availability - from other product stock , different date or quantity

checkedProductStock.description: the product stock too be checked

requestedQuantity.description: Requested quantity to be checked for this product

state.description: State of the CheckProductStockItem (acknowledged, inProgress, terminatedWithError, done)

unit.description: Currency (ISO4217 norm uses 3 letters to define the currency)

Place.description: Place reference. Place defines the places where the products are sold or delivered.

name.description: A user-friendly name for the place, such as [Paris Store], [London Store], [Main Home]

name.description: A user-friendly name for the place, such as [Paris Store], [London Store], [Main Home]

Price.description: Provides all amounts (tax included, duty free, tax rate), used currency and percentage to apply for Price Alteration.

dutyFreeAmount.description: All taxes excluded amount (expressed in the given currency)

taxIncludedAmount.description: All taxes included amount (expressed in the given currency)

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

PriceAlteration.description: Is an amount, usually of money, that modifies the price charged for an order item.

applicationDuration.description: Duration during which the alteration applies on the order item price (for instance 2 months free of charge for the recurring charge)

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail the semantics of this order item price alteration

name.description: Name of the order item price alteration

priceType.description: A category that describes the price such as recurring, one time and usage.

priority.description: Priority level for applying this alteration among all the defined alterations on the order item price

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

Product.description: A product offering procured by a customer or other interested party playing a party role. A product is realized as one or more service(s) and / or resource(s).

description.description: Is the description of the product. It could be copied from the description of the Product Offering.

isBundle.description: If true, the product is a ProductBundle which is an instantiation of a BundledProductOffering. If false, the product is a ProductComponent which is an instantiation of a SimpleProductOffering.

isCustomerVisible.description: If true, the product is visible by the customer.

name.description: Name of the product. It could be the same as the name of the product offering

orderDate.description: Is the date when the product was ordered

productSerialNumber.description: Is the serial number for the product. This is typically applicable to tangible products e.g. Broadband Router.

startDate.description: Is the date from which the product starts

terminationDate.description: Is the date when the product was terminated

status.description: Is the lifecycle status of the product.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

ProductOfferingPriceRef.description: ProductPriceOffering reference. An amount, usually of money, that is asked for or allowed when a ProductOffering is bought, rented, or leased

ProductOfferingRef.description: ProductOffering reference. A product offering represents entities that are orderable from the provider of the catalog, this resource includes pricing information.

ProductPrice.description: An amount, usually of money, that represents the actual price paid by a Customer for a purchase, a rent or a lease of a Product. The price is valid for a defined period of time.

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail the semantics of this product price.

name.description: A short descriptive name such as "Subscription price".

priceType.description: A category that describes the price, such as recurring, discount, allowance, penalty, and so forth.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

ProductRefOrValue.description: A product to be created defined by value or existing defined by reference. The polymorphic attributes @type, @schemaLocation & @referredType are related to the product entity and not the RelatedProductRefOrValue class itself

description.description: Is the description of the product. It could be copied from the description of the Product Offering.

isBundle.description: If true, the product is a ProductBundle which is an instantiation of a BundledProductOffering. If false, the product is a ProductComponent which is an instantiation of a SimpleProductOffering.

isCustomerVisible.description: If true, the product is visible by the customer.

name.description: Name of the product. It could be the same as the name of the product offering

orderDate.description: Is the date when the product was ordered

productSerialNumber.description: Is the serial number for the product. This is typically applicable to tangible products e.g. Broadband Router.

startDate.description: Is the date from which the product starts

terminationDate.description: Is the date when the product was terminated

status.description: Is the lifecycle status of the product.

ProductRelationship.description: Linked products to the one instantiate, such as [bundled] if the product is a bundle and you want to describe the bundled products inside this bundle; [reliesOn] if the product needs another already owned product to rely on (e.g. an option on an already owned mobile access product) [targets] or [isTargeted] (depending on the way of expressing the link) for any other kind of links that may be useful

relationshipType.description: Type of the product relationship, such as [bundled] if the product is a bundle and you want to describe the bundled products inside this bundle; [reliesOn] if the product needs another already owned product to rely on (e.g. an option on an already owned mobile access product) [targets] or [isTargeted] (depending on the way of expressing the link) for any other kind of links that may be useful

ProductSpecificationRef.description: Product specification reference: A ProductSpecification is a detailed description of a tangible or intangible object made available externally in the form of a ProductOffering to customers or other parties playing a party role.

targetProductSchema.description: A target product schema reference. The reference object to the schema and type of target product which is described by product specification.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

ProductStatusType.description: Possible values for the status of the product

ProductStock.description: ProductStock is a base class for defining a product (or configured product with values characteristic) stock level.

creationDate.description: Date when the ProductStock was created (whatever its status).

lastInventoryDate.description: Last inventory count date for this ProductStock.

lastUpdate.description: Last date when the ProductStock record was updated.

replenishmentDate.description: Planned date for future replenishment for this ProductStock.

marketSegment.description: provides references to the corresponding market segment as target of a product stock. A market segment is grouping of Parties, GeographicAreas, SalesChannels, and so forth.

place.description: Used to define a place useful for the ProductStock for example a geographical place where the Product Stock is located

productStockStatusType.description: The status of the ProductStock, such as available, unavailable, reserved, unknown

productStockUsageType.description: The usage type of the  ProductStock, such as inTransit, damaged, onDisplay, etc..

relatedParty.description: A list of related party references (RelatedParty [*]). A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity

resource.description: The Resource managed through this ProductStock is used

stockedProduct.description: Product stocked in this product stock  - could be via a productSpecification, a ProductSpecification + valued characteristic, etc.

amount.description: Numeric value in a given unit

QueryProductStock.description: QueryProductStock is used to query product stock availability

completedQueryProductStockDate.description: Date when the QueryProductStock was completed.

creationDate.description: Date when the QueryProductStock was created.

instantSyncCheck.description: An indicator which when the value is "true" means that requester expects to get result immediately in the response. If the indicator is true then the response code of 200 indicates the operation is successful otherwise a task is created with a response 201.

requestedAvailabilityDate.description: Date when the stock availability should be query.

requestedQueryProductStockDate.description: Date when the requester wished to have a response for this product stock query.

queryProductStockItem.description: A list of query product stock item - only present in response

relatedParty.description: A list of related party references (RelatedParty [*]). A related party defines party or party role linked to this QueryProductStock

searchCriteria.description: Criterias used to perform the query product stock - To be provided in the request.

state.description: State of the CheckProductStock (acknowledged, inProgress, terminatedWithError, done)

RelatedPlaceRefOrValue.description: Related Entity reference. A related place defines a place described by reference or by value linked to a specific entity. The polymorphic attributes @type, @schemaLocation & @referredType are related to the place entity and not the RelatedPlaceRefOrValue class itself

name.description: A user-friendly name for the place, such as [Paris Store], [London Store], [Main Home]

ReserveProductStock.description: ReserveProductStock is used to request a product stock reservation

creationDate.description: Date when the ReserveProductStock was created (whatever its status).

requiredAvailabilityDate.description: Requested product availability date for the reservation.

marketSegment.description: Market segment(s) beneficiary(ies) for this reservation

place.description: Used to define a place where the product stock must be reserved

relatedEntity.description: A list of related  entity in relationship with this stock reservation (trouble ticket, quote, product order, etc...)

relatedParty.description: A list of related party references (RelatedParty [*]). A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity

reserveProductStockItem.description: A list of product stock item reservation

reserveProductStockState.description: State of the ReserveProductStock (acknowledged, inProgress, failed, done, cancelled)

Error.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)
